page.title: 14WALKING NEAR HARTLIP
page.content: Walking is popular around Hartlip , stimulated by the work of the Medway Towns Footpath Group.The area is well served with country lanes and a well marked network of footpaths.There are orchards of different types,mixed farmland,a Nature Reserve,managed & unmanaged woodland.A wide variety of plants can be found in the old hedges & verges,providing a habitat for many creatures.There are attractive views. The directness of the motorway contrasts sharply with the wandering country lanes.Several of the footpaths converge on Hartlip Church,a reminder that although they are now mainly used for recreation,they grew up to serve the needs of the community.There are many attractive buildings and well kept gardens to be seen in the area.
